    • toBitVector

      public static BitSet toBitVector(Shingling shingling, int hashtableSize)

    • signature

      public static int[] signature(BitSet vector, short numberOfHashFunctions, int hastableSize)
      Parameters:
      vector - this method takes a bitVector in form of a BitSet as input
      numberOfHashFunctions - the number of Hashfunctions to simulate
      hastableSize - the hastablesize or number of buckets
      Returns:
      an integer-array which represents the signature. a signature is an array of Integers in which the values represent the index which is hashed gives the first set bit in the signature while incrementing through a number of hashfunction equal to the size of the signature.

    • hashedBandsFromSignature

      public static int[] hashedBandsFromSignature(int[] signature, int numberOfBands)
      Parameters:
      signature - the signature to hash in the format of an Integer Array
      numberOfBands - the number of buckets to create. ceiling(signature.length / numberOfBands) is used to calculated bandsize
      Returns:
      the buckets in form of an integer array. the buckets are created by concatenating all integers in a band and then getting the hashCode for that String. Collisions (aka false positives) can come from two sources: the .hashCode() method of String and the fact that two or more different integers concatenated can result in the same string of digits. Like 122 and 12 resolving to 12212 while 12 and 212 resolve to 12212 too.

    • generateHashFunctions

      public static List<Integer> generateHashFunctions(int numHashes, int numBuckets, Object key)
      This function generates a number of hashvalues from the given key Object those hashvalues fall into numBuckets buckets.
      Parameters:
      numHashes - the number of different hashfunctions to use.
      numBuckets - thoe number of bucket aka the size of the hashtable.
      key - the key to be digested by the hashfunctions
      Returns:
      a List of hashvalues one for each hashfunction
